note.p: Education: Trinity College, Oxford. Created DCL (1793)

Career: Had Buscot Park built for him (1779-1783); High Sheriff of Berkshire (1781-1782); MP for Abingdon (1783-1796); co-founder of the Board of Agriculture (1793); MP for Shaftesbury (1802-1812); magistrate (JP) in Berkshire, Wiltshire and Oxfordshire; Lieutenant-Colonel, Berkshire militia
Notes: Details surrounding the divorce in: Lawrence Stone, Broken lives : separation and divorce in England 1660-1857 (Oxford: OUP, 1993), p.248-269
